intro: Calceolaria pedunculata, commonly known as the hanging lantern flower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its striking, hooded flowers that resemble small lanterns. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and produces showy, bilaterally symmetrical blooms. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture, while its stems are erect and branched. Calceolaria pedunculata is appreciated in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in cool, humid conditions.
